Advertisers Index

51936.name: The Rotten Apple: Manhattan
51936.description:
Publisher blurb:

Dominated by the Manhattan Development Consortium (MDC), the City represents the largest contiguous corporate enclave in the Sixth World. This volume grants a look into the neighborhoods of Manhattan, the constant scrutiny of its security, and the activities of the thirteen corporations that oversee its development.

This setting is a crucial part of the New York City Shadowrun Missions campaign. This 32-page volume serves as a guide to players so that they can prepare their characters to deal with the finer details of the setting. Gamemasters are also well suited to use this book, as it grants them a deeper insight into the neighborhoods of Manhattan than can be provided in scenarios.

51937.name: High Passage (Issue 4)
51937.description:
Issue number 4 (of 5) of High Passage: A Ticket to Traveller Adventure

Cover by William H. Keith, Jr. depicts a group of adventurers observing illegal operations on an interdicted planet.

All articles are for Traveller (Classic)

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

51939.name: SHOLF
51939.description:
Sholf is a hybrid creation of two classic games. Sholf fuses the accessories of golf with the strategy, competitive play and scoring of table shuffleboard. Played head-to-head, Sholf is wildly addicting and fun for all skill levels. Anyone can play, day or night, indoors or out. Sholf's portability makes it possible to play anywhere, all the time!

If you know how to play table shuffleboard, then you pretty much know how to play Sholf.

The object of Sholf is to putt your golf balls further into the scoring end than your opponent. Point values increase as you get closer to the edge of the playing green. The first player or team of players to 15 wins.

Visit the Sholf website: http://sholf.com/

51940.name: GURPS Supers Adventures
51940.description:
"Four Fantastic Super-Scenarios"

User Summary:

Four Adventures written for GURPS Supers (Second Edition)

- Jupiter Blues
- Mark of the Kraken – two parts
- Web of Zyrani

51941.name: Unknown Armies

rpgissuearticle.150448: A Few of My Favorite Things

51941.description:
From the cover:

A Roleplaying Game of Transcendental Horror and Furious Action

51942.name: High Passage (Issue 5)

rpgissuearticle.36666: Awaiting Shipment: Wines, Liquors, and Beverages

51942.description:
Issue number 5 (of 5) of High Passage: A Ticket to Traveller Adventure

Uncredited cover art depicts a band of adventurers preparing to visit the Gathering on Fisher's World.

All articles are for Traveller (Classic)

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

51945.name: Utopia
51945.description:
From Back Cover:

When hunters are first awakened to the supernatural, all they know is terror, paranoia and chaos. The unseen world is a nightmare. But the imbued have a dream. They imagine a paradise free from monsters' grip, a world of humanity's own. And they set out to achieve it, even if it means sacrificing everything they - and the rest of humanity - hold dear.

Hunter: Utopia explores ways in which hunters might strive to break monsters' hold over humanity whether in a neighborhood, throughout a city or across the world. But can such a Utopia be achieved? Can the monsters be defeated or is it an unattainable dream? You decide.

51946.name: HERO Hexman Dice
51946.description:
User summary:

Sixed dice with the HERO Logo on the one and numbers 2-6 on the other sides. On each face of each die is the amount of BODY damage done by STUN attacks: two pips on the 6 face, and one pip on sides 2-5.

Each die has a mass of 10 grams and is 2 centimeters cubed.

51947.name: Loose Alliances
51947.description:
From the back of the book:

Corps don't give a drek about the runners they hire that's why they call us expendable assets. Forget working for the Mob or the Yakuza, too once you're in, you're part of their family for the rest of your life. Lucky for us, there are swarms of other groups looking to claim their piece of sprawl and who are willing to bypass the law to do it. Policlubs, magical orders, religious factions, black marketers these are just a few of the species struggling for survival in the shadow ecology. Hooking up with such an organization has its advantages resources, steady employment, backup but pick the wrong outfit to run with and you'll regret it when they kick you to curb. So what's it going to be, chummer? You can't roll solo forever.

Loose Alliances is a sourcebook for organizations that operate by their own set of rules in the Shadowrun world. From political factions and religious movements to treasure hunters and organleggers, it provides a wealth of information on the more obscure parties in the shadows and the benefits and drawbacks that come with them. Loose Alliances broadens the world of Shadowrun for player and gamemaster alike.

51948.name: Customizable Game Master Screen
51948.description: This version is a 3 fold, landscape heavy duty screen which holds 3 inserts on the player's side and 3 inserts on the game master's side. This version from Pinnacle was supported by various inserts for their line of games, but obviously is generic in nature.

51949.name: The Harrensa Project / The Stazhlekh Report
51949.description:
Double adventure, literally two back-to-back adventures from FASA with no indication of which is the first.

The Harrensa Project: (From Introduction)

This adventure, The Harrensa Project deals with industrial espionage, personal combat, and survival in various environments. High Guard, Citizens of the Imperium and Ordeal by Eshaar may prove useful. Players may wish to refer to issues of High Passage magazine for additional data on The Old Expanses.

The Stazhlekh Report: (From Introduction)

This advenure, The Stazhlekh Report, centers on a commando operation geared to gain vital military intelligence that may influence the course of an interstellar conflict. FASA's Trail of the Sky Raisers presents further background on Desaekhe and the Descaronthe Hegemony and the League of Suns which preceded the war that figures in their adventure.

51950.name: The World of Aden
51950.description:
From the back cover:

"The World of Aden features everything you need to start a role-playing campaign in this exciting fantasy setting. You'll learn about the kingdoms of Aden, the Orders that serve them, and the hideous nocturnals that threaten their very existence. Delve into the secrets of mechamagic; ride one the awe-inspiring thunder trains; battle to save a world from overwhelming evil. Also included are character templates for use in the World of Aden, new equipment, spells and Background Options."

and

"Based on the hit computer roleplaying game series by SSI."

51951.name: S.H.A.D.O.W. over Scotland
51951.description:
From the back cover:

"Your destination si a sleepy little village on the northeastern coast of Scotland. Just off shore, an ancient, haunted, castle sits on its own island. Many of the houses and cottages sit abandoned, and the townspeople that remain move about motivated by something more powerful than the fear of God. They talk in hushed tones of a series of unsolved murders an disappearances. Some actually believe the rumors of werewolves and vampires! Have you accidentally slipped into the 17th century? No, you've stepped into spine-tingling Danger International action.

S.H.A.D.O.W. over Scotland comes with 8 pages of layouts, and lots of NPC descriptions for plenty of mystery/horror adventure!"

51952.name: Lockdown
51952.description:
Note that Lockdown was originally published in pdf form as a 1st edition book and then updated to 2nd edition and republished.

From the publisher's website:

So your heroes have captured yet another super-villain. Where are they going to put them all? In prison, of course!

Lockdown is a sourcebook for Mutants & Masterminds, describing a prison for super-convicts. It details all four levels of the Buckner Ridge Superhuman Penitentiary, the first privately run super-prison. You get details on the prison's layout, operations, and staff, including its super-powered guards. Lockdown has profiles on various inmates and factions within the prison, as well as a description of the nearby town of Buckner Ridge. Lockdown saved its failing economy, but is it worth the price of having a prison full of the world's most dangerous super-criminals in its backyard?

Lockdown comes with numerous adventure ideas and ways to use the prison in your own Mutants & Masterminds campaign. You can make it a background element or build an entire game where the characters are convicts! Plus, Lockdown comes with a secret: a conspiracy that could bring the prison crashing down and threaten law and order across the world!

Note that Lockdown was originally published in pdf form as a 1st edition book and then updated to 2nd edition and republished.

51953.name: Supplement IV: Gods, Demi-Gods & Heroes
51953.description:
Excerpt from the foreword by Timothy J. Kask:

What the authors have done in this volume is to attempt to set down guidelines that will enable you to incorporate a number of various mythologies into your game/campaign. They make no claims that any of this material presented is exhaustive, or even infallible.

51954.name: Creatures of Middle-earth (2nd Edition)

rpg.1568: Lord of the Rings Adventure Game

51954.description:
From the Back of the book:
"Creatures" details the significant beasts and monsters of Tolkien's world - the kelvar, living things that move, born of the Great Song, such as ravens, ulmodili (dolphins), mearas (descendants of Orome's steed), oliphaunts, great eagles, crebain, the Kirinkir of fallen Númenor, and black swans; as well as the twisted things "of horn and ivory" that "dye the earth with blood" at Morgoth's behest.

51955.name: Glory Days
51955.description:
From the back of the book:

"Glory Days is the first era book for Brave New World, the roleplaying game of superpowered heroes in a fascist America. It comes complete with everything you need to play Brave New World in the opening days of America's involvement in World War II: new combat rules, new weapons and vehicles, profiles for dozens of deltas who can help or hinder your cause, and 10 brand-new power packages good for use in any era."

"It is time to make your Uncle Sam proud. Enlist now!"

51956.name: Evil Unlimited
51956.description:
From the back of the book:

The Evil Unlimited soucebook for Brave New World draws back the corporate veil on the most powerful criminal organization in the world. It comes complete with six brand-new power packages, plus a full-length adventure that's perfect for introducing heroes into a world of evil.

51958.name: Blake's 7 Role-Playing Game
51958.description:
From the Overview:

The book you are now reading is a set of rules for recreating and portraying the setting of Blake's 7. Using them, you can take on the roles of characters from the BBC television science-fiction series, usually as rebels or fugitives from the oppressive Federation. Players have the choice of creating their own individual characters or adopting their favourite characters (Blake, Avon, etc.) from the series.

51959.name: Mazes & Minotaurs Character Record Sheet
51959.description: Three official character record sheets were released in PDF format as supplements for the M&M game system.

51960.name: Nature Dome
51960.description:
From publishers web site:

Nature Dome is an easy-to-learn, beautifully illustrated dueling card game that includes 50 animal Power Cards, 5 Attack Boost cards and countless hours of fun for players of all ages.

Take turns attacking, defending and escaping as you score hits and diminish your opponent's Health Points. The first player to knock their opponent out wins the round!

It's a fun, family-friendly way to encourage imagination, reinforce addition and subtraction skills, develop strategic thinking and learn about animals from the everyday to the very weird and from all corners of the world.

Each Nature Dome deck is complete and ready to play out of the box; or combine it with your other Nature Dome decks for more dynamic play than ever before.

From Box:
Step into Nature Dome

Where gifted individuals are united and trained to become master warriors who wield weapons as old as the world.

The weapons are nature's fury itself: tooth and claw, hide and bone, limb and tail. Summoned by magic and scaled to your human size, they are yours to control. Because you are among the chosen few to enter... NATURE DOME.

51961.name: Adventurer (Issue 1 - Apr 1986)
51961.description:
From the cover:
ISSUE 1

White Fire:
A Call of Cthulhu Mystery.

The Black Tower:
A Rolemaster/AD&D adventure.

Cover Story:
£50 worth of games could be yours!

Plus!
Articles, reviews, humor and news.

Colour poster inside!

51962.name: Nocturnals: A Midnight Companion

rpghonor.14230: 2004 ENnie Best Graphic Design and Layout - Gold Winner

51962.description:
Sourcebook for Mutants and Masterminds 1e based on Dan Brereton's Nocturnals comic series.

Publisher's blurb:
Doc Horror's family is looking for new blood in the nighttime war against Evil. Enter the shadows of Dan Brereton's acclaimed monster-noir masterpiece with this essential Nocturnals sourcebook. A Midnight Companion gives you the full story on all your favorite Nocturnals characters, from heroes like Halloween Girl and Gunwitch to spooky ne'er-do-wells like The Hideous League and Keera the Bat Queen. Delve into the secrets of mysterious Pacific City, the dreaded, other-dimensional Crim, and the subterranean ruins of the soul-stealing Skerrll.

You'll also meet a new villain in a never-before-seen 8-page comic. You want more? How about all the rules you need to run a Nocturnals campaign with the Mutants & Masterminds RPG? Play the Nocturnals themselves or create your own hybrid pulp tough-guys or spectral creatures of the night. Co-written by an award- winning team-up of Dan Brereton and game designer Chris Pramas, A Midnight Companion is perfect for game and comic fans alike.

51963.name: Dawnfire
51963.description:
From the back cover:

"A world where Magic permeates all; from the smallest child to the strongest warrior; from common animals to the grandest dragons; and from a single blade of grass to the greatest mountains.

Included in this rule book are:

A complete players guide with everything needed to create a character including: 12 core and 6 optional character races, statistics, religions and extensive skill, spell, and equipment lists.
A complete Firelord section
A simple yet realistic combat system
A unique magic system which includes guidelines for creating new spells.
Over 50 pages of creatures, with notes on how to make almost all of them into player characters."

51964.name: Sport Tietopeli
51964.description: Very classic sport trivia game from Finland. 3000 questions on 500 cards from every sport category possible, and I mean every. The game is played like a race around the station. Game board is also like a station. There are four rows - one for each player! Among them are colors that represent the question that you have to answer. You answer correst you move on. There are also 100 Joker cards among those 500. Sometimes you get instead of color a picture of a cup. Then it's time for a Joker question. Joker questions are YES/NO answers. The winner is the one who get to the finish first!

51965.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 77 - Feb 1987)
51965.description:
A Complete Paranoia Solo Adventure

This was the first issue of Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer following the split from The VIP of Gaming.

51968.name: Dark Champions:Heroes of Vengeance  (First Edition)
51968.description:
From the back of the book:

This is the ultimate source book for the twilight world of vigilante superheroes who walk the line between justice and vengeance! Experience gritty, intense adventures that bring you new shades of four-color action in the tradition of your favorite hard-hitting superhero comics. Dark Champions creates a new universe of super excitement for you to explore - or a new dimension of roleplaying for your existing Champions campaign!

51969.name: Bargainers
51969.description:
From the back of the book:

The Bargainers sourcebook for Brave New World comes complete with full details on the most mysterious kind of deltas of all, those who follow in the footsteps of the great Houdini himself: the Bargainers. Packed with new kinds of totems and details on who's who in Bargaining society, this is one book that no aspiring Bargainer can be without.

51970.name: Delta Prime
51970.description:
From the back of the book

If you're a delta - a person with superhuman powers - you're required by United States law to register them with the government. And once you do, you become their employee for life.

Sure, some folks aren't happy working for Uncle Sam - those terrorists calling themselves the Defiance, for instance - but they don't understand that it's the greater good.

As a Primer, you're one of the few and the proud, a stalwart hero who has decided to put aside his personal life and dedicate himself to making this country - and by extension, the world - a safe place to live in.

When Uncle Sam calls upon you to perform your patriotic duty, he knows you can do your part. Your're a memeber o Delta Prime, America's top delta team, and you know that you might have to do to anything for your country - anything.

And you do it without question, because you know that it's right.

It's for the greater good, after all.

Nothing else matters.

The Delta Prime sourcebook for Brave New World comes packed with details about the Primers, their goals, as well guidelines for playing heroes who work for them. Included are six brand-new power packages tailor-made for Primer heroes, plus new details on Primer gadgeteers and their dreaded Armorgeddon power armor.

You respect the law. You registered.

Now it's time to get to work!

51971.name: Front Est
51971.description:
A book for Blitzkrieg with


New army list (Finland and paratroopers for USSR)
New scenarios and campaigns ( Finland, Barbarossa, and the battle for Berlin)
A big map for Kursk

51972.name: Bram Stoker's Dracula Role Playing Game
51972.description:
From the back of the book

Dracula, the greatest of Vampires, came to London to create a new empire and to find his long-lost love. In spite of his powers, he was driven away and eventually destroyed by a band of Vampie Hunters led by Professor Abraham Van Helsing.

Dracula has been defeated, but he left behind a brood of newly created Vampires, just learning to use their powers. Older and stronger Vampires have also arrived from their ancient lands, drawn by the same life and energy that attracted Dracula.

Now you must face the power of darkness. You must learn how to hunt and defeat Vampires and their allies, while protecting the innocent. As you pursue the Vampires, you will find yourself being hunted in turn, as they seek to convert or kill you.

The Bram Stoker's Dracula Role Playing Game includes complete rules for Vampires and for settings from Medieval times to the present. Based on the hit Columbia Pictures move and featuring dozens of color and black-and-white photos, this game captures the romance, mystery, and adventure of the film, and is fully compatible with all film based games from Leading Edge.

51973.name: The Coronation Street Game
51973.description: Each player takes on the role as a Coronation Street character. Each player must visit 5 locations and collect object cards and rescue one of Jack's pigeons. The first player to collect all 5 object cards and a pigeon, and return to their starting place and answer a Coronation Street trivia question is the winner.

51974.name: The FCI Consumer Guide
51974.description:
Full title:
Freedonian Consumer Institute Product Research Division Consumer Guide Volume 1

From Introduction:

...Report on equipment and accessories.

The player's section is designed for easy reference. It gives the item name and technology level where the item first becomes available. Then it lists information about weigh, dimensions, and cost. Under this, is a paragraph explaining use of the item and other useful informaiton.

The referee's section gives the names of three manufacturers, how available their product is, and how reliable. It also explains some dangers or drawbacks the item can have. This allows the referee to choose the quality and price of the items made available to the players and possible things which could go wrong.

51975.name: Solstice
51975.description:
Solstice is a simple yet challenging table-top farming game guaranteed to spark fun and creativity among everyone playing.

A table-top board game for two to four players, each player plays the role of a farmer. Players get a plot of land to use as they please, with the ultimate goal of bringing in the greatest amount of money over the course of 5 years. At the end of the 5th year, each player sells off everything they have and the farmer with the most money wins!

51976.name: Call It A Day
51976.description:
In Call It A Day!, a player is chosen to be storyteller, and begins by drawing one of over 200 Alias cards. The Alias card reveals the character for that round. The character might be a teacher or time traveler, mermaid or movie star, vet or vampire—or one of hundreds of other familiar and fantastical possibilities.

Now it's time to see what might happen in the character’s story. Draw eight of the more than 700 Call It A Day! Activity cards. The storyteller’s job is to tell a story that includes at least six of the eight Activities drawn. The storyteller now weaves a story, arranging the cards in whatever order helps tell the best story.

After the story has been told, the other players rate it from zero to five. The storyteller function then passes to the next player, with each storyteller drawing new Aliases and Activites and telling stories for a predetermined number of rounds. The player with the highest score wins.

51977.name: The Delian Book of the Dead
51977.description:
From the publisher:

In Fantasy Role-Play, death is real and important but, as in life, it is also much ignored. When a Player Character dies, the event is treated with only slightly more importance than the death of an NPC or a monster. However, this need not be the case and, in Delos at least, death can sometimes simply be the beginning.

The Delian Book of the Dead introduces the Character Class: Deceased (Phantom) along with an examination of the role of the departed spirit as a Player Character. Other topics include funeral rites, phantom magicks and other spirit-related magicks as well as the nature of the afterlife and the Planes of the Abyss and other matters of importance to those recently deceased.

Table of Contents (abbreviated)

Character Class: Deceased (Phantom): While not all who die are capable of returning as phantoms, for those who do, a life after death can be a rewarding existence.

Phantom Class Abilities & Limitations: Just as death brings an end to old abilities, life as a phantom -- if you'll pardon the expression -- brings new skills and fresh possibilities.

Phantom Magicks: While mortal magicks are of little use to those of the phantasmal persuasions, life after death does not mean that there are no magicks to be mastered.

New Spells & Spirit-Related Magicks: While little attention is paid elsewhere to magicks used by mortals in connection with spirits, those adventuring with phantoms may well find these new spells useful in their endeavors.

Character Class: Archaeologist: Long before Indiana Jones appeared, archaeological adventurers were wandering the paths and byways of Delos. Sharing some of the abilities of the Thieves class, Archaeologist have their own skills, interests and abilities.

Notable Tombs of Delos: Excerpted from The Complete Cracksman by Professor R. J. Raffles, Prof. Emeritus of the University School of the Delian Thieves Guild, Professor Raffles was well noted for her personal investigations of many of the more remote areas of the Delian Commonwealth.

Funeral Rites of the Commonwealth: Quite aside from possible personal participation, the wise adventurer may well find a knowledge of both guild and regional funeral rites an advantage in remaining among the living.

Gem Stones & Other Jewels: It's all very well to scoop up a chance handful of gems in the hopes of finding them profitable ... but how well do you know your gemstones ... and not just which ones are profitable but which ones are safe to handle at all?

Natural Hazards & Other Dangers: In Delos, the adventurer not only must contend with monsters and wildlife but should also be wary of less obvious dangers ... because some are not obvious at all.

And Doors On New Vistas Opening: Most are accustomed to using doors without a second thought ... but, occasionally, doors are more than they appear ...

Arms and Armour: ... of course, weapons are not always the answer ... but they are, sometimes, the question ...

A Gentle Cup of Poison From the Hand of a Friend: Accomplishing the transition from the world of the living to the Planes Beyond may be undertaken in many ways ... and one such route might be ...

Mirrors and Other Windows: As we all are aware, ghosts and other specters, like vampires, can not be seen in mirrors ... or can they ...?

And, For Light Reading,...: Notes on books, scrolls and other writings which may be encountered while adventuring ... but not always safely ...

A Matter of Menagerie: On the care, seeking and acquisition of strange pets ... (and the consequences of living with them later...)

The Book of the Planes: Just as the Delian Commonwealth encompasses many diverse peoples, so too does the Delian afterlife present a diversity of places, planes and regions which are commonly referred to as the Neather Planes, the Abyss or the Great Beyond. In some cases, these regions are even accessible to mortals (via the Well of the Worlds) and a number of the more popular regions and their inhabitants are described here.

The Horn of Hern: The Horn of Hern is an adventure designed for the recently deceased but is not limited to those who have passed beyond. As a mission offered by Amazon Mutual Life Assurance, this is a challenge for the living and the dead alike ... and may lead to a most singular conclusion.

51978.name: Island of Dr. Destroyer

rpgissuearticle.39969: Game Reviews - Island of Dr. Destroyer

51978.description:
The first published Champions adventure pits the heroes against Dr. Destroyer. The super team must storm the island hideout, fend off a legion of mercenary agents, battle a team of super villains and defeat the Doctor himself before he can launch his Mind Control Satellite and take over the world!

The adventure is very much in the 'four-colour' standard super heroic style and presents Dr. Destroyer as a force to be reckoned within the Champions Universe.

Written for Champions First Edition, this adventure is easily adapted to any other version of that system.

51980.name: Beyond the Sacred Table
51980.description:
From the Introduction:

"In this volume of the Delian Chronicles from Dragon Tree Press, we have undertaken two objectives: first, to satisfy requests for additional information on the nature and geography of the World of Delos and, second, to offer an introduction to a new dimension in fantasy gaming, the world of Live-Action gaming."

51981.name: Promised Sands
51981.description:
From the (now defunct) website:

"Promised Sands, as a complete rethinking of the dark, desert fantasy setting, presents rich and detailed new artwork from many artists in the industry. Some are up-and-coming artists whose art can just now be found amongst the newest title releases from other publishers and other art is from fresh faces in the industry who are making a name for themselves with bold and sweeping strokes.

The world of T'nah--the game world for Promised Sands--is a very detailed place. It boasts a rich, 3000+ years of historical development. It is a well-thought out, realistic, widely diverse place full of in-depth and fleshed-out cultures. While the overall feel of the world has a strong Renaissance Arabic influence, there is something for everyone in this world."

51982.name: The Monsterous Civilizations of Delos
51982.description:
From the publisher:

"In Delos, Monsters aren't always ... visit the Ogre Nations of Delos, travel the Forests of Night and meet the legendary Wampyr and their Wool-o-the-Wisp and explore the legendary Broken Lands where even the normal is stranger than you can imagine. As you journey through the Monstrous Civilizations of Delos, you'll learn the real perils of succubi, how to get a giant drunk and (maybe) what has become of the fabled Gnoptic Chalice. Overall a dastardly miscellany of new traps, poisons, artifacts...."

51983.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 80 - Oct 1987)
51983.description:
Star Blazers

Cover courtesy of 20th Century Imports

51984.name: Desert Plots: Amazon Mutual #2
51984.description:
From the covers:

"A desert mystery campaign plot with two complete dungeons, 5 plot outlines, 13 new monsters, 18 new magic items, and 18 new traps & tricks. AD&D modules & generic plots linking The Efreet Secret Weapon, Adventurer's Life Assurance, The Great Art of Master Ovid & His Good Demons, The Orcan Liberation Front, The Sexual Mores of the Efreeti Queen, and Belworth George - The Paladin of St. Fallwell."

51985.name: The Ultimate Brick

rpgissuearticle.63438: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…

51985.description:
A staple of fiction since time immemorial, The Brick has been the focus of stories since before the written word. Capable of feats of amazing strength and capable of withstanding astounding punishment, these powerhouses have stood as both heroes and villains in countless tales.

This source book for the HERO System gives you everything you need to build strong and super-strong characters. Plot hooks, power tricks, powers, advantages and limitations are presented, as are many example brick characters.

51986.name: The Book of Plots Vol. 1
51986.description:
From the covers:

"Plots for over 30 dungeons. Will fit most modules of any system. How to play plot adventures. Background on the world of Delos. Hack-Proof mysteries, comedies, hoaxes, poems & con-games."

51987.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 81 - Jan 1988)
51987.description:
Ten Years of Ogre and Traveller

Note that month of publication is an estimate. No date was given in the magazine!

51988.name: A Guide to Covert Ops
51988.description:
From the back of the book:

A space armada slowly takes shape a hundred million kilometers above the elliptical plane of a star; the target planet does not have the military to stop the massive BattleMech invasion about to be unleashed on their world. Instead, a handful of men slowly maneuver in disguised, pressurized, polymer bags towards their targets. After attaching to the ships, they cut a hole in the bulkhead and sneak towards the fragile Kearny-Fuchida core that makes interstellar travel possible. Knowing death is the only outcome, they disable the fleet, aborting the invasion before it has begun, changing the course of history. They have no name, no history, no life beyond their service to the State. They are covert operatives.

A Guide to Covert Ops provides detailed information on every intelligence agency in the BattleTech universe. Additionally, extensive Life Paths covering everything from DEST to Lohengrin and Valkyrie to guerrilla insurgents are included. Finally, new specialized espionage gear, campaigning rules and a complete adventure provide all the information and tools players and Gamemasters alike will need to enter the covert world of special ops.

51989.name: Amazon Mutual Wants You!
51989.description:
From the covers:

"Four short adventures for use with D&D and AD&D: Temple of the Four Gods, Stronghold of the Mer-Witch, Mission to Danger, and Grimethorp's Manor. Four short modules suitable for low-level thinkers or med-high level hackers. This edition includes: pre-figured experience points, plot summaries, monster/trap summaries, and character levels for different styles of play."

51990.description:
Not every interstellar power can afford the likes of the Wolf's Dragoons. Not every world has the resources to hire even a lance from the elite Kell Hounds. That doesn't mean war doesn't come in the form of objective raids, internal power struggles or outright piracy to such factions and backwater worlds. For such, any mercenary group will do, even the dregs. If they can point and shoot, someone, somewhere, will hire them.

A companion volume to Classic BattleTech Field Manual: Mercenaries, Revised, the Mercenaries Supplemental™ provides an in-depth look at a few of the best and many of the worst known Inner Sphere mercenary commands, including histories, officers, and favorite tactics. Special rules allow players to use these commands in their Classic BattleTech campaigns, while a new point-based construction system provides an optional way to generate mercenary commands.
51990.name: Classic Battletech: Mercenaries Supplemental

51991.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 82 - Jul 1988)

rpgissuearticle.17487: Black Sword, Pursuit of the White Wolf

51991.description:
Rogue Trooper

Cover artist: Dave Gibbons

This was the last issue published by Diverse Talents Incorporated, hinted at by an advertising insert for 3W that references a non-existent editorial on this subject.

51992.name: Stones of the Selt
51992.description:
A fantasy whodunit adventure for for character levels 1-5.

Billed as "Expae Island Mystery Number One", and lists three other planned scenarios in the series, but none of them were published.

51993.name: Crescent City
51993.description:
From the back of the book:

Inside you will find everything you need to role-play the struggles of the Promethean City. Included are six new power packages straight from the streets (and bay) of Crescent City, maps, more villains and NPCs than ever before, a break down of the five neighborhoods of Crescent City, and a setting unlike anything else on earth.

51994.name: 22 Talent Trees
51994.description:
From the Publisher's website:

Are you bored by the dearth of talent trees presented in the Modern core rules? Do you wish your heroes had more options? Do you pine for Offensive Driving and and a little Domination?

22 Talent Trees presents 86 new talents (grouped into 22 trees) for the core classes. With this supplement you can play Strong heroes who use their Mighty Hurling talents to throw objects extreme distances. Or perhaps you prefer a Fast hero who can use the Quicker than the Eye talents to gain a blur or displacement effect! Or would you rather play the Tough hero with FX Resistance and withstand the power of magic? What about the Quick Thinking Smart heroes who can use their talents to take action before other characters even figure out what is going on? Maybe you would prefer a Dedicated hero, devoted to the service others and able to donate their will power, their financial resources, and even their very life to another person in need. And finally, who could resist the pulchritudinous Charismatic hero with her Stunning Beauty?

These and dozens of other innovative ideas fill the pages of this supplement!

51995.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 83 - Oct 1988)

rpgissuearticle.17558: Aerial Warfare in Call of Cthulhu

51995.description:
Sky Galleons of Mars

This was the first issue published by World Wide Wargames.

51996.name: Thrill Park
51996.description:
You've got a brilliant idea. You've got the inspiration. You've got the backing to get started. You're going to build an amusement park to attract thrill seekers from all around, and you're going to rake in the money!

There's just one problem...

There are others who share your idea (and your enthusiasm), and you've found yourself in a race to see who can develop their park the most quickly and efficiently. Will you build a large rollercoaster, or will you add a swinging Pirate Ship? Will you add a soda stand to compliment that burger stand at the park's entrance? Do you even have enough money in the bank to build any of these attractions?

Play Thrill Park to see who will attract the largest crowds, and capture the hearts of thrill seekers everywhere!

51997.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 84 - Dec 1988)
51997.description:
Halls of Fortune

Cover artist: Roy "Lucky" Lopez

51999.name: 007: Il Gioco di James Bond
51999.description:
From box cover:
You will only be able to defeat the criminal minds which have conceived the greatest conspiracy of all times only if you are worthy of James Bond. But to be successful, you must prove you have the distinctive qualities of the legendary "007" secret agent!
Further to the special James Bond dice, the game also includes 110 illustraded cards with pictures taken from famous James Bond movies.
A real collection for all fans of the adventures Her Majesty's sevret agent has been through!

Contents:
110 special cards
3 special dice
150 punched cardboard tokens
6 plastic "Bond" markers
1 standard plastic marker
1 game board
1 set of rule

52000.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Issue 85 - Jan 1989)

rpgissuearticle.17618: A Biography of David L. Arneson

52000.description:
Space 1889

World Wide Wargames changed the name back to Space Gamer with the next issue.
